alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 7:35AM EST until January 12 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Locks. * WHEN...From this morning to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. At 12.0 feet, Dock Street is closed between Pear Street and East Main Street...State Route 5. At 12.8 feet, Water enters the Intermediate Terminal area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:54 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage by late this morning, then crest at 13.1 feet late tonight. The river is then expected to stay above flood stage through Thursday before falling below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.0 feet on 02/26/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM EST.
